org.fluidity.composition

Interface ComponentContext


  • public interface ComponentContext
    The run-time context for a component instance. This is the object that components may receive as a dependency to encapsulate the context in which they were instantiated.

    A context represents configuration at the point of reference to a component, which it elects to receive using the @Component.Qualifiers annotation. The context is defined by the referring components using custom, user defined, annotations, and are consumed by referred to components that list the custom annotations' type in their @Component.Qualifiers annotation.

    Since contexts offer a static configuration mechanism, components with other means of configuration can be adapted to context based configuration using a ComponentFactory, which essentially translates the configuration embedded in the instantiation context to configuration understood by the component being adapted.

    Usage

     @Retention(RetentionPolicy.RUNTIME)
 public @interface MyQualifier1 { … }
 
     @Retention(RetentionPolicy.RUNTIME)
 public @interface MyQualifier2 { … }
 
     @MyQualifier1
 @Component
 public final class ContextProvider {

     ContextProvider(final @MyQualifier2 dependency) {
         …
     }

     …
 }
 
     @Component
 @Component.Qualifiers({ MyQualifier1.class,  MyQualifier2.class })
 final class Dependency {

     Dependency(final ComponentContext context) {

         // all MyQualifier1 annotations in the instantiation path of this object
         MyQualifier1[] context1s = context.annotations(MyQualifier1.class);

         // the last MyQualifier2 annotation in the instantiation path of this object
         MyQualifier2 context2 = context.annotation(MyQualifier2.class, Dependency.class);
     }
 }

      Tells whether the context contains a qualifier annotation of the given type.
      String descriptor()
      Returns a textual representation of this context that describes it.
      String key()
      Returns a textual representation of this context that uniquely identifies it.

    • Method Detail

      • qualifiers

        <T extends Annotation> T[] qualifiers(Class<T> type)
        Returns all instances of the given qualifier annotation type in the instantiation path of the component that received this object in its constructor. Annotations may be defined at multiple points along a reference path and so multiple annotations may be present for any given type. This method returns all of the instances according to the annotation's accumulation setting in the order they were encountered in the reference path.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the annotation type.
        Parameters:
        type - the annotation type to return instances of.
        Returns:
        all qualifier annotations of the given type, or an empty array or null if none present.
        See Also:
        defines(Class)

      • qualifier

        <T extends Annotation> T qualifier(Class<T> type,
                                   Class<?> caller)
                            throws ComponentContainer.ResolutionException
        Returns the last instance of the given qualifier annotation type in the instantiation path of the component that received this object in its constructor. If an optional caller argument is supplied and no annotation of the given type is found, an exception mentioning the given caller is thrown.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the annotation type.
        Parameters:
        type - the annotation type to return instances of.
        caller - the optional caller to mention in the exception thrown when no annotation of the given type is present; may be null.
        Returns:
        the last qualifier annotation of the given type or null if none present.
        Throws:
        ComponentContainer.ResolutionException - when the caller parameter is not null and no annotation of the given type is found.
        See Also:
        defines(Class)

      • defines

        boolean defines(Class<? extends Annotation> type)
        Tells whether the context contains a qualifier annotation of the given type.
        Parameters:
        type - the annotation type to check the existence of instances of.
        Returns:
        true if least one instance of the annotation of the given type is found, false otherwise.

      • types

        Set<Class<? extends Annotation>> types()
        Returns the set of qualifier annotation types the context contains instances of.
        Returns:
        a Set; never null.

      • key

        String key()
        Returns a textual representation of this context that uniquely identifies it. Used internally by Fluid Tools.
        Returns:
        a String; never null.

      • descriptor

        String descriptor()
        Returns a textual representation of this context that describes it. Used internally by Fluid Tools.
        Returns:
        a String; never null.
